title: ITRI Virtual Museum - Scene 7
content:
工研院線上展示館 │ ITRI Virtual Showroom
Hsin-I Lin
Hsin-I Lin graduated from National Cheng Kung University. He worked as the General Manager and Vice Chairman of China Motor Corporation (CMC), Chairman of the Formosa Ha Tinh Steel Corporation, Minister of Economic Affairs, Chairperson of the Council for Economic Planning and Development, and Vice Premier of the Executive Yuan.

Upon graduation in 1970, Mr. Lin started working in automobile manufacturing, the driving force of industrial developments. He broke through many technical bottlenecks and established a complete and solid division of labor system for the automobile industry. He used management science to improve overall performance and significantly increased CMC’s sales volume, reviving CMC and making it a top and long-lasting manufacturer of the industry. He is known as the “Lee Iacocca of Taiwan's automobile industry.”

Mr. Lin served as the sixth Chairman of ITRI in 2000 and as the eighth Chairman in 2004. During his term, he emphasized that innovation and R&D must create added value and encouraged the development of original patents and R&D. In addition, he focused on using new technology to create new value and business opportunities for industries. In 2005, Mr. Lin served as the President’s Special Envoy and took part in Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation’s informal leader summit meeting in Busan, Korea, on behalf of the President. He had positive interactions with then President of the People's Republic of China Jintao Hu, US President George W. Bush, and Prime Minister of Australia John Howard.
Moisture Wicking Fabric
ITRI has developed a functional moisture wicking fabric called HydroPore®. This innovative fabric has applications in athletic and leisure clothing, and in cotton and wool spinning products, enhancing the R&D ability of Taiwan's synthetic fiber industry.

Hall 51 Research Center in the 2000s
ITRI has been investing in advanced research in materials, machinery, information and communication, LED, flexible display, etc., to drive the innovation of industrial technology. A number of technological breakthroughs have won international awards, increasing their global visibility. With effective patent strategies and a patent transaction platform, ITRI has created new value for industries and assisted them in gaining an edge in international competition.
生態樹 ─ 樹頂
● 生態樹的應用情境－光合作用
─ 概念說明：光合作用是植物利用陽光來製造能量(碳水化合物)的一種機制。

─ 技術應用情境：於生態樹上方天窗架設工研院研發之「太陽能發電窗」技術，用以展示太陽能發電窗利用陽光發電的情境。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：每片太陽能發電窗尺寸是110*90公分（約1平方米），發電量是18瓦；在生態樹示範面積內有20片，總發電量約360瓦。

● 生態樹的應用情境－淨化空氣
─ 概念說明：樹木透過光合作用中吸收二氧化碳與排放氧氣的過程，可達到淨化空氣的效果，此外植物散發的揮發性物質「芬多精」也可殺死空氣中的細菌、害蟲以及病原菌。

─ 技術應用情境：利用生態樹冠上塗層的自然光觸媒技術，來達到抵抗空間病菌及分解有機揮發氣體(VOC)的效果。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：樹冠內隱藏風扇可每小時讓整個空間換氣7次以上，並吹過光觸媒塗層區，淨化空氣。光觸媒抗菌效能可達99.99%，1g奈米光觸媒可分解20微克有機揮發性氣體（甲醛）。

Chintay Shih
Chintay Shih received his bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from National Taiwan University, master’s degree in management science from Stanford University, and Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering from Princeton University. He was a senior engineer at Burroughs Corp. In 1976, Dr. Shih returned to Taiwan and joined ITRI. He took part in the integrated circuit project and was one of the trainees who went to the US. The project successfully introduced semiconductor technology to Taiwan and opened a new chapter for the industry.

Dr. Shih worked as a technology advisor at the Executive Yuan, Chairman of Asia Pacific Intellectual Property Association, Chairman of Taiwan Semiconductor Industry Association, Chairman of Chinese Society for Management of Technology, President of Chinese Institute of Engineers, and Chairman of Monte Jade Science and Technology Association of Taiwan and Global Monte Jade Science and Technology Association. Due to his outstanding contribution to Taiwan’s semiconductor industry, Dr. Shih became the Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers and the Chinese Society for Management of Technology. He also received National Chiao Tung University and National Tsing Hua University (NTHU) honorary doctorates and the Ministry of Economic Affairs First Class Medal.

Dr. Shih worked at ITRI as an engineer, Manager, General Director, and Executive Vice President. In 1994, he served as ITRI’s fifth President and encouraged advanced nanometer, biomedicine, and knowledge-based services. He also built open labs and innovation incubation centers and promoted organization revival and full resources operations, making ITRI an internationally-known research institution. In 2004, Dr. Shih became the Dean of the College of Technology Management at NTHU. In 2008, he served as the ninth Chairman of ITRI, and in 2009 served as the Chairman of the Institute for Information Industry.
生態樹 ─ 樹根
● 生態樹的應用情境－潔淨水質
─ 概念說明：樹木的根部具有涵養水源的功能，有一些水生植物則具有分解與浄化水質的功能。

─ 技術應用情境： Qwater為一模組化且可快速組裝之淨水系統，核心技術為生物膜濾技術，係結合「(生物)濾床區」和「薄膜分離區」之創新水與廢水處理系統。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：Qwater技術特別適用於原水或低濃度污水處理，適合應用於生活污水、工業廢水、洗車廢水、社區/學校簡易自來水等處理及中水回收等。
Nano Pigment Technology
ITRI developed nano pigment technology 
that ensures excellent uniformity in image output and high inkjet printing speed. The technology has been transferred to local companies to enhance international competitiveness.
Johnsee Lee
Johnsee Lee received his bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from National Central University (NCU), master’s degree in business management from the University of Chicago, and Ph.D. from the Illinois Institute of Technology (Illinois Tech). He was a principal investigator and researcher at Argonne National Laboratory and senior researcher and manager at Johnson & Johnson. Dr. Lee returned to Taiwan in 1990 and served as the Deputy General Director and General Director of ITRI’s Chemical Research Laboratories and ITRI’s Executive Vice President. He was the co-principal investigator of national-level biotech and pharmaceutical projects, the Project Director of Bioengineering and Material R&D project as well as the Advanced Innovation R&D Technology Development Program from the Ministry of Economic Affairs.
In 2003, Dr. Lee became the sixth President of ITRI and Convener of the biomedical science technology domain. During his term, he introduced enterprise-style operations and created an “extensive innovation” R&D environment that emphasized the concept of applying technology creatively. Under his leadership, ITRI’s patent ranking entered Global Top 50 and the Institute received many international R&D awards, including the R&D 100 Awards and The Wall Street Journal Technology Innovation Awards. This led to several startups in fields such as energy, biotech, machinery, semiconductor, and information and communication technology.
Dr. Lee received an Outstanding Alumni Award from NCU and was named the Fellow of the Chinese Society for Management of Technology. He is also the recipient of the Outstanding International Alumni of Illinois Tech, the Construction Medal from the Chinese Institute of Chemical Engineers, the Chinese Institute of Engineers USA Outstanding Service Medal, and the World Chinese Leadership Visionary Award.
Jin-Fu Chang
Jin-Fu Chang graduated from the Department of Electrical Engineering at National Taiwan University (NTU) and obtained his Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering and computer sciences from the University of California, Berkeley. He was a lecturer, associate professor, professor, Head of Department, and Director of the Department of Electronics Engineering at NTU; Director of the Science & Technology Advisory Office, Ministry of Education; professor and Vice President for Academic Affairs at National Central University; Deputy Minister of the National Science Council, Executive Yuan; President of National Chi Nan University; and Chairperson of the University Entrance Committee for Overseas Chinese Students.

Dr. Chang is an Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Fellow and his fields of research include performance analysis, communications technology, and mobile communication. He has published hundreds of papers in these fields and has long been assisting the Taiwanese government to increase digitization in industries, which has a great impact on the development of computer science in Taiwan.

In 2008, he served as a Minister without Portfolio at the Executive Yuan and assumed the role of Chairman at ITRI in October during the same year. He was dedicated to connecting ITRI with the world, winning the attention of many international accolades for the institute’s advanced R&D results. This was also the time when ITRI won its first R&D 100 Awards.
Cheng-I Weng
Cheng-I Weng obtained his bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), and master’s and Ph.D. degrees in mechanical engineering from the University of Rochester. He was the President of NCKU; Chairperson of the Taiwan Machine Manufacturing Corporation; Chairperson of the Aviation Safety Council, Executive Yuan; and Minister of the National Science Council, Executive Yuan.

During his time at the National Science Council, Dr. Weng actively promoted national technology policies and led the research and development of high-tech industries, contributing significantly to the improvement of Taiwan’s economy, industries, and high-tech R&D. When he was the President of NCKU, he actively took part in the industry introduction project of Tainan Science Park and was indispensable in the investment-seeking and overall park planning process of the Southern Taiwan Science Park. Dr. Weng is a recipient of the Outstanding Research Award from the Ministry of Education, the Outstanding Research Award from the National Science Council, the Society of Theoretical and Applied Mechanics of the Republic of China medal, and the Chinese Society of Mechanical Engineers medal.

Dr. Weng served as the seventh Chairman of ITRI. When in office, Dr. Weng actively promoted nanotechnology development as well as the R&D and technology transfer of cutting-edge technology. He also strengthened collaborations between ITRI and the academia and facilitated the establishment of ITRI’s Southern Region Campus. He is crucial in bridging the technology development gap between northern and southern Taiwan.
生態樹 ─ 樹幹
● 生態樹的應用情境－調節溫度
─ 概念說明：樹木也具有調節溫度的功能，透過樹蔭反射/阻隔/蒸散等功能，可調節冷熱空氣的對流與循環。

─ 技術應用情境：於生態樹上方天窗架設熱氣排出口，再利用太陽能發電窗所產生的電力，驅動生態樹冠上的風扇向下吹送，造成空間氣流的循環效果。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：位於樹冠內的六台風扇全開（1台由太陽能供電/5台由市電供電，每台出風量每分鐘57立方米），於中央挑高區容積(2,646立方米)，每小時可以將空氣循環約7.7次。

● 生態樹的應用情境－情境照明
─ 概念說明：樹木除了具有環境循環與調節的功能外，對人類來說還具有觀賞與造景功能。

─ 技術應用情境：利用擴散光板與LED燈結合之情境照明，搭配生態樹本身的藝術造型，來營造整個空間美學的藝術內涵。此外擴散光板與LED燈也可隨時因應日照變化調節室內光線。

─ 技術應用特色與效益：
生態樹擴散光板示範效能穿透度光約70%，霧度約30%；LED燈的耗電量約3,417瓦，相對於同樣光通量之彩色鹵素燈約14,903瓦，其耗電量只有23%。
Biochips
ITRI developed biochips and relevant patented technologies. The biochip production speed was increased 100 times, reducing production costs to 1/10 of the original price. This helped the establishment of ITRI's spinoff Phalanx Biotech and Taiwan's entry into the global OEM market for biochips.
